Question: Q. What is the purpose of a Bunsen burner in a laboratory?
Q. What safety equipment should be worn when working with chemicals in a laboratory?
Option A: A) Safety goggles and lab coat

Question: Q. What is the function of a fume hood in a laboratory?
Option B: B) To provide ventilation and remove harmful fumes

Question: Q. What is the purpose of a centrifuge in a laboratory?
Option B: B) To separate substances based on density

Question: Q. What does the term "sterilization" mean in a laboratory setting?
Option A: A) Cleaning glassware with soap and water
Option C: C) Destroying all microorganisms on surfaces or equipment
Option D: D) Keeping equipment organized and tidy

Question: Q. What is the purpose of a microscope in a laboratory?
Option B: B) To view small objects or organisms

Question: Q. What safety precautions should be taken when using a microscope in a laboratory?
Option A: A) Ensure the area is well-ventilated
Option B: B) Keep the microscope clean and free of debris
Option C: C) Avoid touching the lenses with fingers

Question: Q. What is the function of a pH meter in a laboratory?
Option A: A) To measure acidity or alkalinity of a solution

Question: Q. What is the purpose of a balance in a laboratory?
Q. What is the function of a pipette in a laboratory?
Q. What does the term "titration" mean in a laboratory setting?
Option A: A) A technique to measure the volume of a liquid
Option B: B) A technique to measure the mass of a solid
Option C: C) A technique to determine the concentration of a solution
Option D: D) A technique to sterilize equipment

Question: Q. What safety precautions should be taken when handling acids and bases in a laboratory?
Option A: A) Wear gloves and safety goggles
Option B: B) Work in a well-ventilated area
Option C: C) Use caution when mixing chemicals

Question: Q. What is the purpose of a spectrophotometer in a laboratory?
Option D: D) To analyze the concentration of a substance in a solution

Question: Q. What is the function of an autoclave in a laboratory?
Option C: C) To sterilize equipment using steam under pressure

Question: Q. What is the purpose of a Petri dish in a laboratory?
Q. What safety precautions should be taken when using a hot plate in a laboratory?
Option C: C) Turn off the hot plate when not in use

Question: Q. What is the function of an incubator in a laboratory?
Q. What is the purpose of a safety shower and eyewash station in a laboratory?
Option B: B) To provide emergency decontamination in case of exposure to chemicals

Question: Q. What safety precautions should be taken when working with open flames in a laboratory?
Option A: A) Tie back long hair and loose clothing
Option B: B) Keep flammable materials away from the flame

Question: Q. What is the purpose of a vacuum pump in a laboratory?
Option C: C) To remove air or gas from a container

Question: Q. What is the function of a desiccator in a laboratory?
Option C: C) To absorb moisture from substances

Question: Q. What safety precautions should be taken when working with electricity in a laboratory?
Option A: A) Avoid using damaged cords or equipment
Option B: B) Use insulated gloves when handling electrical equipment
Option C: C) Disconnect power before servicing equipment

Question: Q. What is the purpose of a conductivity meter in a laboratory?
Option C: C) To measure the ability of a solution to conduct electricity

Question: Q. What is the function of a magnetic stirrer in a laboratory?
Option B: B) To mix solutions using a rotating magnetic field

Question: Q. What safety precautions should be taken when working with toxic chemicals in a laboratory?
Option B: B) Wear appropriate personal protective equipment
Option C: C) Handle chemicals in a well-ventilated area

Question: Q. What is the purpose of a laboratory notebook?
Option C: C) To record experimental procedures and results

Question: Q. What is the function of a shaker in a laboratory?
Option B: B) To mix solutions by shaking

Question: Q. What safety precautions should be taken when working with cryogenic materials in a laboratory?
Option A: A) Wear appropriate personal protective equipment
Option B: B) Handle materials in a well-ventilated area
